name: HD 7199
scenarioDescription:
The HD 7199 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 7199 is a star with 0.77 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.97 times its radius. It is located 118.04 light years away from the solar system.

HD 7199 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 7199 system


HD 7199 b

HD 7199 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 7199 b is 85.86 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 7199 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 7199, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
